Reviews.Content: great place to stay!       photo taken from Diamond Head
Reviews.Author: dlbiowa

Reviews.Content: Fantastic service My partner, Glenn and I stayed here in June/July this year en-route from Australia to and from the west coast of the US. Great amenities  tremendous staff who would go out of their way to assist. The newly renovated guest suites are delightful. Just a stones throw from Queen's Surf and Hula's Bar, this little gem in the middle of Waikiki is a must stay venue for gay travellers to Hawaii. Do yourself a favour - we did!!!Mahalo to the entire team!!Phil  GlennAlice SpringsCentral Australia
Reviews.Author: Rainbowsalwaysrule!!

Reviews.Content: The Cabana at Waikiki- You get what you pay for I know that alot of people have had a bad experience at the Cabana, mostly due to run ins with cockroaches, rude staff etc. My partner and I spent 10 days there, and we had a great time. Our room was large, had a kitchenette and was clean. If there were roaches, I didn't see any. The only interaction we had with the staff was when we checked in and when we checked out. The bottom line is this place is very inexpensive so don't expect any sort of luxury.
Reviews.Author: PhillyMatt

Reviews.Content: Okay Place       Bathroom
Reviews.Author: PGA2

Reviews.Content: great place come back for a second look Thingsare really on the improve at this hotel, whether you are by yourself or in a group his is the place to stay.i have stayed in other hotels and paid the price, everyone is friendly and the hotel is small enough to know all their gueststhey have made many improvements over th last couple of years, so come nd have a look, remmber it is what it is, it is not 5 star.when i stay in a muli storey hotel i feel so closed in ,and you never meet anyone, it is so different here.The other thing is it's a gay hotel and good on the team for provding a hotel for the gay community.I ave found over the years the term gay friendly as so many hotels claim, just doesn't cut it, anyone can claim thatanyway see for yourself and on your next trip stay a night or two YOU WILL BE BACK
Reviews.Author: turneresj

Reviews.Content: Home in Waikiki I have been fortunate in that since 1994 I have been able to live in Hawaii up to 7 1/2 weeks a year, making as many as 4 trips in one year. In that time I have stayed in 11 properties from one end of Waikiki to the other. Hands down The Cabana is where I prefer to stay. It is steps from the beach, good restaurants and a great gay bar. The gay beach is a short walk into Queen Kapiolani Park with plenty of eye candy along the way. I find the rooms spacious (by Hawaiian standards) and love the fact that when the sliding door is open along with the widows on the oposite end of the room the trade winds will blow through. I enjoy the separate seating area and my afternoon naps on the daybed. It is by far the quietest location in which Iv'e stayed. I cannot imagine staying in some mega-resort tourist trap facility with 100 kids peeing in the pool!I would recommend this property to my friends---I have invited a couple to stay with me when they visit this summer!
Reviews.Author: EscapeToWaikiki

Reviews.Content: right in the heart of gay Hawaii We were told that The Cabana was THE PLACE to be while on Ohau... and our friends were right.Great place, We had a blast.
Reviews.Author: JamesMalc

Reviews.Content: ENJOYED the Cabana... Our stay with the Cabana at Waikiki last week was indeed wonderful. Cabana staff were very attentive and courteous at all times, our room was very cozy and more importantly really clean.This is definitely one of THE place and/or spot to consider onto your future trips to Hawaii, as i surely had a great stay at the CABANA. John - LOS ANGELES CA
Reviews.Author: jonhinlacalifornia

Reviews.Content: A gem for the holidays Since there has been some construction and remodeling of late, and this has put some of the writers on this site in a bad frame of mind, thought I would take time to let you in on my stays at Cabana. I am a regular during the Christmas/New Year's holidays and have stayed at Cabana from its earliest days. Also been there for Lei Day. I have developed a good rapport with the manager and staff because I believe you only get as much out of a vacation experience as you put into it. A smile and a cheery greeting goes a long way to ensure you'll be treated the same way. I have seen a number of dour guests over the years and wondered if they would ever be happy anywhere! ([-]) Friends who stay here and I have a great time at the thrice weekly cocktail hours hosted by the staff. We pick up a variety of treats (some flown in from Japan) and make up our own pupu platters, and we share with all others staying here who want to socialize with other guests. The public space is small and cozy, adjacent to a hot tub that some guys enjoy both after the beach and before bed. We have even invited other friends to drop by and have a drink with us, and the staff couldn't be more accommodating or happier. The structure itself is reminiscent of what one might call a motel of an earlier era. Over the years the rooms have been redecorated, and, in fact, that's taking place right now. There are 15 two-room mini-suites, with a small lanai for the smokers among us. No, there's no fab view of the beach because you're not paying beachfront prices, but are located just a few minutes walk from the surf and one of Honolulu's busiest bars. Each mini-suite has a TV, VCR (hear these are being replaced this year with DVDs and it's about time) and CD player. Plus there's a small kitchen area in each with mini-fridge, blender, microwave and dishes and utensils, just in case you want to eat in. These rooms are ideal for a couple, and more than ample space for a single. You could even put a third on the couch, but three people in one bathroom...well, need I say more? The housekeeping staff keeps the facility clean as a whistle and will accommodate requests for extra this or that...requested with a smile and a mahalo. There's washers and dryers in case you need to do laundry. And one staffer is quite knowledgeable about tours and rentals and is more than happy to help you book everything from snorkeling to barefoot cruises. Waikiki is noisy early in the morning because of all the hotels... service trucks and garbage trucks begin their rounds well before 8. If you need quiet, then sleep with the doors and windows closed (anathema in Hawaii), and crank up the air conditioning! So if you need total quiet and prefer to be by yourself (i.e., not interested in socializing with others), then I'd recommend a cottage on the Windward side of the island, maybe even a tent on the North Shore. (Don't stay here...it's too friendly.) But if you want a fun experience in a comfortable setting close to all the action (dining, shopping, beach, bars), then Cabana at Waikiki is a best bet. Oh, is it a bargain? No, but then I haven't found any bargains in Waikiki in years. Prices fluctuate at various times of the year, just like the airline ticket prices do from month to month. So, ask the manager, Jim, if he's got a rate special coming up at any time of the year and book a room then. And we all hope the owners won't jack up the price when the remodeling project is completed. But, ya know, if they do, I think I'll still stay there. I'm hooked on the location and the friendly staff. You know, a smile and aloha goes a long way. Have a mai tai on me!
Reviews.Author: NapaPiero

Reviews.Content: Just what we were looking for... We highly recomend the Cabanna for a gay vacation. We carefully researched the Cabanna on-line and made several phone calls to ask questions about features that were important to us. We were looking for a gay hotel where we didnt have to deal with straight couples googling over the gay couple.  We wanted to stay at a gay hotel that was not a form of a bathhouse. We wanted a large room. We wanted a reasonable price. We wanted to be close to the beach and a pool or lack of a pool didnt matter to us. In fact by not having a pool we were convinced that this would not be cruise central. We wanted a friendly staff who would be helpful but also know when to leave us alone. We found all that at the Cabanna. The staff was friendly and helpful without being in your face. We were located on a back street just yards from the beach, nightlife, world class shopping and dining. Our room rate was considerably less than staying at the Hilton and we got everything we paid for- a large, clean, updated room. I have read some of the reviews that paint the Cabanna and its staff not in the best light. I do not agree with those reviews - We did our reseach and found what we were looking for. We found the Cabana to be a very good deal and we will be back next year with friends.
Reviews.Author: ChiCouple1234

Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for my business travel. Love the Cabana I have been staying at the Cabana for over 3 years on a monthly basis and it has consistently met my expectations. It is a very comfortable property that suits me well while conducting business in the area each month. The location is wonderful because it is off the main roads and is small and quiet and not like other resorts in the Waikiki area. While there are no restaurants, room service at the property, there are so many options located conveniently around the area as well as a kitchenette in the rooms if one is so inclined. The location is perfect as well for the beach, one of the most popular clubs in the area and the great shopping.The staff at the Cabana are friendly, helpful and always remember me on return stays. It is very nice to see a friendly, familiar face on so many return trips. The 3 times weekly complimentary happy hour is also a great place to mingle with other guests. I have met many new friends over the years just from going to the happy hours alone!Overall, the Cabana is a perfect place to stay for business because there is also the opportunity for leisure time and socialization. With the remodeling of the rooms that is planned in the next couple of months, I think the overall quality will become even more outstanding.
Reviews.Author: mrobert85

Reviews.Content: Nice place The Cabanas is basically a nice place. The rooms are clean and well furnished. It's location is good. It is on a back alley but that seclusion from the other hotels. While there is limited parking at the hotel, they have made arrangements with the hotel next door for parking. The one downside for me was the lack of a pool. But other than that, it was a nice place with friendly staff. I'd definitely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: tinstaafl2

Reviews.Content: Lots of Aloha I have stayed at the Cabana for years and continue to return. The staff is always there to greet with a smile and goes out of their way to make sure I have everything I need.Besides the convenient parking, closeness to the best Waikiki restaurants and pubs- it is always fantastic to have quality wine glasses and a wine key in the room! I have stayed at all the surrounding hotels when the Cabana is booked and trust me the Cabana has the best bed hands down.Looking forward to next months visit and keep up the great work!
Reviews.Author: Mauirealestateman

Reviews.Content: Love the Cabana! I and my Boyfriend have stayed at the Cabana for at least the last 6 year end vacation times. I have found the staff exremely friendly and helpful. Actually, it is like visitng family when we go there. The accommodations aren't like the Hilton Hawaiian but I wouldn''t stay at the Hilton Hawaiian even if I could afford it. I would rather be at the Cabana.
Reviews.Author: hawaiilosangeles

Reviews.Content: Disappointed not to have a more sociable time We stayed at the Cabanas for two nights at the end of our Hawaii holiday. We'd already had a couple of nights at the Aqua Aloha Surf Hotel where our room was unexpectedly smart and with excellent views across the city. In contrast, the room at the Cabanas was dark and rather gloomy, with nothing in the way of a view.Staff were friendly enough and helpfully arranged an early check-in for us. However we didn't meet any other guests during our stay and we were the only two people who showed up for the drinks party on Thursday evening. The shared areas of the Cabanas are not conducive to socialising and we didn't even consider using the hot tub - it simply wasn't in a nice enough setting.Overall, we rather regretted moving from the other location.
Reviews.Author: JerryBTW2

Reviews.Content: not that bad really it's not that bad really, sure the photos really do make it look good,and it is centrally located, but it is what it s a tired old motel slowly been done up.What worried me was when you were in the hot tub, you could clearly be seen by the neighbours through the fence, not at all private, forget the carpark make into an entertainment area, at least half of it.The toilets back up the doors don't allways lock and i gave up on the breakfast. the maid was freindly ,however she asked for a tip at the end of the stay, thats fair i guess.The staff were not interested or friendly to anyone, the younger staff are there for the wages and thats it, the less they have to do the better. the office is not 24hrs so if your coming from the other side of the world and arrive at midnight they will make arrangements, i enjoyed my stay visiting room to room, meeting like minded guys, it really needs a pool or a larger sitiing or sun arean perhaps on the roof.one thing is good at least it's a gay motel not just gay friendly.i say try it out for a least one day then go to the other gay bbs like absolute paradise (big island) or isle of you big island , that is where you will really get looked after.But good on Cabana for at least providing a good gay service ps don't go down to max's gym sauna very unfriendly
Reviews.Author: turner1717

Reviews.Content: It's a Motel not a Resort! Our room at the Cabana was very comfortable and clean. We enjoyed the bed and the living space, but the view was least to be desired. This place is a great Motel, and should not be considered anything but one. It should not be called a Hotel, an Inn, and definately not a Resort. It is far from one and I encourage the owners to drop the word RESORT from their marketing material. It is misleading and false advertising. The pictures in their marketing material create the illusion that you will be staying at a Resort - don't be fooled! We enjoyed our stay, however far overpriced for what we got - a MOTEL!
Reviews.Author: InHawaiiwithBF

Reviews.Content: Shockingly bad Great location, if only our shuttle driver could have found it. We ended up walking half a block trying to locate it in what appeared to be an alley. My partner and I were quite shocked at what we found; a converted apartment building. Others have mentioned the lack of warmth and friendliness from the desk clerk and we concur. Besides the maid, who was very friendly, the only time we got someone to treat us as a special guest was the person selling us tour packages. We thought the room accomodations were okay but nothing special. However, the bathroom was very small and dirty. The late breakfast is pathetic and the hot tub is located a couple of steps from the check-in desk. Don't expect a big social hour. Drinks (when they offer them) were okay but were self serve in pitchers, sitting outside with the bugs and gechos. This place is NOTHING like the ads say. Avoid it all costs if you want to stay in a place with a resort atmosphere and friendly staff. If you just need a place to toss your bags and hit the beach, this place is for you.
Reviews.Author: Oklahomawind

Reviews.Content: Not What It Claims to Be Rooms: large but with furniture from a thrift store. Service: non-existent. Ambience: your room will overlook an apartment building. Claims on the web site: outrageous. If this is an exclusive, quiet, upscale resort bathed in sun then so is a Howard Johnson's in the Bronx.This dump might be OK IF all you need is a place to crash after partying, but you still need to watch out for the posse of homeless (and possibly crazy) people who hang around the parking lot.I had a reservation for 7 nights and stayed for two. I regret being there so long. Would never set foot in this dump again.
Reviews.Author: JMDRWAC

Reviews.Content: needs some TLC what is shown on the website doesn't really match to what you see when you arrive. the hot tub is terrible, parking is under the hotel and the breakfast area is attached, feels like you are eating in the parking garage. the staff are not helpful at all. rooms are large and were very clean, toilet kept getting plugged, location is good but i would stay at the marriot next time.
Reviews.Author: pineappleguy

Reviews.Content: Criminal Establishment Do not stay here. The employees seem like borderline criminals. Horrible conditions. No locks. I actually felt endangered. Nothing advertised is accurate. Not only that, but Expedia included this in a package in which they are criminally liable as well. The agreement between Expedia and the Hotel was that we would be refunded, but the hotel later rescinded. Total disaster.
Reviews.Author: allandye

Reviews.Content: Just once I'm trying to make this short because of what has already been written here by others. This place is overpriced and yes, the staff is party friendly but not showing interest in your business as a guest. The way the cabana is advertised is a joke. There is no tropical garden, the hot tub is filled with pure water (germs!!!) and located in the least relaxing spot. Breakfast is served very late so that I rather had it somewhere else besides what I saw was served didn't really appeal to me. The rooms are not at all clean - the only good thing I can say about the cabana is that it is located in a convenient part of Waikiki. Again? No!
Reviews.Author: AlexHamburg

Reviews.Content: Sad decline of a "used to be, friendly place to stay. I have stayed at the Cabana exactly 8 times over the years. - I was very impressed with overall quality of the facilities and location for the first couple of visits. - Then I noticed a gradual decline in upkeep. - Room furnishings became shabby and worn. Each time I booked the prices were higher and the service poorer. - The last two occasions the staff were barely civil, very lazy and they had changed their cleaning staff. - The bathroom needed maintenance and mildew was taking over the shower recess. - The curtains and windows had become faded worn and full of dust. (Not good for asthma). - Breakfast included in the rate was pathetic - Tiny boxes of cereal - bread to toast and watered down juice. - Cartons of yoghurt and stale sugary pre-packaged cakes.... - The new electronic safe would not work and the staff did not know how to operate it. They eventually told me - I could not use it and that was that. The ceiling fan was tilting at a dangerous angle and could not be used even on lowest speed setting, without wobbling dangerously and making a terrible noise. The desk staff were lazy and disinterested and when contacted about maintenance problems just could not care. The new cleaning staff were slapdash - What happened to the nice friendly maid? - Upon arrival with a two heavy large bags and a few smaller ones, I was unpleasantly surprised when assigned a room on the top floor - I had to lug my bags up myself (no elevator) whilst two strapping men lazily chatted behind the check-in desk. - (a lost opportunity for a tip). After two days of discomfort and being too intimidated to complain... I checked out and moved to a much more comfortable hotel with elevator - staff who were very helpful with baggage - wonderful views - and most of all a room safe which worked - a clean bathroom ... a hot and cold buffet breakfast was included in the rate which was a third cheaper than the Cabana. - The Cabana is sadly going to the dogs - The prices are outrageous for facilities not provided. no Bell hop assistance - lack of elevators etc., This was supposed to be a Gay Hotel. - On my floor the guests were mainly 18-19 year old Hetero men with their girlfriends. - They trafficked up and down the corridor visiting each other's rooms until very early morning - this accompanied by the racket from the central airconditioner from the building next door made for very disturbed sleep. Sadly it is time to move on - Hopefully they will restore the great atmosphere from years gone by and return to the Cabana that I used to call a home away from home. As there were no night staff at the Cabana - I did not feel very secure and there was no security staff to check on the noise problems etc., Non residents just seemed to wander in off the street. The security door being wedged open by the teenagers who were being disruptive. - I guess I am taking the time to write this because I care and really feel saddened the way a really great place has been run into the ground.
Reviews.Author: IntrepidCardiff

Reviews.Content: disappointed We stayed for 5 days in the delux room, having been to other gay hotels we were in for a shock. The room was clean but basic for the price with a small deck that faced another building a few feet away. The hot tub we looked forward to was crammed outside the office window on the small patio where the tables to eat a pre-pakaged breakfast were. The activities staff was unfriendly, as he just kept to himself at his desk and tried not to interact with guests. The front desk staff was on the whole friendly but not helpful and did not seem to know the area at all! Will not be returning to this hotel and not worth the price.
Reviews.Author: randyjeep

Reviews.Content: Always a Pleasure This was my third stay at The Cabana. If you like the idea of a hotel with a gay clientele, and a close proximity to the beach and to Hula's Bar, the Cabana is for you. The rooms are all mini-suites, including kitchenettes. Although there is no stove in the room, there is a microwave, and it is possible to prepare meals in your room with a bit of planning. Dishes, pots, pans, glasses, and cutlery are all provided. The hotel has beach chairs and game equipment to lend, as well as a library of videos for short-term rental.Don't expect a 'wild gay time'. Do expect friendly service and an efficient cleaning staff.
Reviews.Author: Keith_Montgomery

Reviews.Content: Only Fair The Good:- good location close to the beach- maids were very good and very nice people- nicely decorated roomThe Bad:- With the exception of 1 front desk guy, the staff and management were very cool. Not friendly at all and not helpful. We wanted to partonize a gay business but the atmosphere at the hotel was not friendly.- Not cheap...for what you paid you could stay in a much nicer place elsewhere- Hotel management didn't even say thank you' for staying with us when we left...he could barely lift his head from the desk- Noise - asked for a quiet room, but got a room at the end next to the street. We thought this would be ok but there are windows on the street side and starting at 5am in the morning a lot of truck noise, beeping etc etc. Not restfulOverall, I would recommend that you stay somewhere else...somewhere that actually appreciates your business and at least a little bit friendly! Management should take note of this.
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: The Cabana was wonderful We stayed at The Cabana in late February. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the location was ideal. The room was wonderful - large, and a nice porch. Housekeeping went out of their way to take care of little things right away. I know other's commented about noise from adjacent properties, but we didn't experience that at all. My only regret (which isn't the hotel's fault) is that our flight back to the US didn't leave until late in the evening. The Cabana will do 1/2 day rates for late departure, when available - unfortunately we didn't know that in advance and they were totally booked so couldn't accomodate us. Next time we'll probably just book an entire extra day so we can enjoy the beach all day and have a place to come back and get cleaned up before we leave. We'll definitely stay at The Cabana when next we go to Honolulu.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A must The Cabana at Waikiki is a fantastically well managed, clean and friendly place to stay. It is so close to Waikiki beach, the local bars, restaurants and night life. The apartments look fresh and new. The staff are wonderful. There are cocktail evenings several times a week around the hot tub. You can get to meet other people on their travels. A real friendly place that scores highly on my list.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great room, but that's about it Having a great room is, of course, pretty important. The rooms at the Cabana are stylish mini-suites with a living area with sofa and TV, and a Hawaiian-style bed with a log wood base. There's a little kitchen in the corner of the living area. The maid service was excellent; extra towels were offered without asking on the last day so we could shower before checking out. But beyond the room, there's nothing much else. The hot tub is small and stuck in the corner of the tiny patio; they call it clothing optional but there's hardly space to move, and what there is is not fully shielded from neighboring buildings. Breakfast was basic - cereal, bread, peanut butter and calorie-laden pre-wrapped pastries; nothing fresh. Healthy choices were limited to pieces of fruit (whole, not salad) and yogurt. And while breakfast was included, everything else, from parking to video rental, was extra: this on a room which cost more than $150 a night. The location is good, close to the beach, restaurants and nightlife. Go there for a relaxed atmosphere and a nice room, but don't expect anything more.
Reviews.Author: Scot_Wha's_Away

Reviews.Content: A great place to stay close to everything !!! I spent the last two weekend staying at the Cabana on the Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights each week whilst visitng the Hawaiian Islands from England.The best things about the Cabana are the lovely friendly staff who are very chatty and fun and the location.. it is just a couple of minutes walk from Hulas which is the best gay bar in Honolulu and from the gay beach.. I spent far too much time in Hulas each night... hic !!! The accomodation is reasonably comfortable and very clean.. There is a lounge with sofa and television and kitchenette and a bedroom area whcih can be spearate from the living room. There is a hot tub outdoors and they serve free cocktails several times a week. There is also a free breakfast between 9 and 11 each morning which gives you another chance to chat to fellow guests. The only gripe I have is that I don't like their policy of taking a deposit of about $100 for your room key and phone... Whilst they don't take the money for themselves it is pre-authorised and so goes out of your bank account till you leave. This seems unnecessary and having travelled far and wide all over the world this is the first time anywhere this has happened.I can't wait to go back to Honolulu and can't imagine staying anywhere else other than the Cabana.
Reviews.Author: lee_bear

Reviews.Content: Great location, nice rooms I usually shy away from specifically gay places but decided to give this one a try on my first trip to Hawaii.I really loved the place. My room was a really great size - much more than I expected. Also the spa is great. Although it's clothes optional policy is a bit daunting when you can see the dribs and drabs of the youth hostel next door! It would have been nice to have stayed somewhere with a pool. Luckily the beach is literally around the corner.Overall, I would definitely recommend the place.
Reviews.Author: anthonyuk

Reviews.Content: A pleasant surprise After a few nights at another hotel we moved over to the Cabana (caters to gay males). It wasn't a deliberate move but, rather, we had to due to limited room availabilities at our original hotel over the Christmas holiday. We were quite pleased with our new accomodations. The room was spacious (seperated bedroom), clean and decorated in a tropical motif. The bathrooms and carpeting appear to be recently renovated. Three nights a week they have a free happy hour with tropical drinks - a good start before heading over to Hulas which is just a short block away. The drawbacks include no pool (though there is a jacuzzi), no view to speak of, potentially limited parking if you have a car and being located next to an international hostel created noise issues. We will certainly consider staying here again next trip to Waikiki. Tip: try the noodle shop next to the ABC Store around the corner for a cheap dinner - nothing fancy but pretty good and the staff is quite entertaining.
Reviews.Author: MZR

Reviews.Content: Thumbs up! The Cabana at Waikiki is convenient to the gay beach and Hula's, the pre-eminent Honolulu gay bar. The rooms are spacious, nicely decorated, and comfortable. The staff is helpful, and always willing to help with recommendations for dinner or sightseeing. You can't beat the location or value. I will return.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
